peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to authenticate Pre-Columbian art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Look for Provenance: Do some research and make sure that the seller can provide a provenance or history of the item. This should include the tribes that the piece belonged to, the location where it was found and dates of ownership.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How To Ensure the Authenticity of Pre-Columbian Pottery

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is it legal to own Pre-Columbian art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: It is against the law of the United States to bring most pre-Columbian art into this country. Maya pottery from the Peten area is especially illegal. When tempted to buy antiquities in Central America all kinds of tall tales will be given to encourage you to buy.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Notice on Antiquities Laws relative to Maya Art.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What are the characteristics of Pre-Columbian art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Most art was abstract in nature. Inca ceramics were primarily large vessels covered in geometric designs. Inca tunics and textiles contained similar motifs, often checkerboard patterns reserved for the Inca elite and the Inca army.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Pre-Columbian art - Wikipedia
